" - Scott G. ★★★★★ " We had the strong and steady guidance of Traudel Lange behind us and beside us as we hunted for the perfect house for our family. We could not have asked for a better and a more professional team. We recommend them highly. After getting to know what our family's needs were, our tastes and our lifestyle choices, Traudel showed us only the houses that she knew held potential. We greatly appreciated having her sort through the listings for us instead of trying to show us everything out there as other realtors have done in the past. We were on a tight time frame and Traudel ensured that we moved quickly but in a determined manner through new listings. We felt as though we were her top-most priority—thank you, Traudel! Traudel was also extremely helpful in helping manage our expectations and the expectations of potential sellers in terms of working to a common goal. We never felt that Traudel was trying to push or force us into a decision one way or another. She might not have agreed with us on certain aspects of negotiating the fine points of a deal, and while she let us know gently, she had our best interests at heart. Her endless supply of granola bars kept our children humming the whole time we were house hunting, and we loved the rapport both Traudel had with our children. Our daughter even explained to us one night over dinner that "real estate agents are the spice of life!" Dear Traudel, thank you for all your work in helping us find the right house for us—as soon as we are unpacked, you must come by! " ★★★★★ " We had the strong and steady guidance of Traudel Lange behind us and beside us as we hunted for the perfect house for our family. We could not have asked for a better and a more professional team. We recommend them highly. After getting to know what our family's needs were, our tastes and our lifestyle choices, Traudel showed us only the houses that she knew held potential. We greatly appreciated having her sort through the listings for us instead of trying to show us everything out there as other realtors have done in the past. We were on a tight time frame and Traudel ensured that we moved quickly but in a determined manner through new listings. We felt as though we were her top-most priority—thank you, Traudel! Traudel was also extremely helpful in helping manage our expectations and the expectations of potential sellers in terms of working to a common goal. We never felt that Traudel was trying to push or force us into a decision one way or another. She might not have agreed with us on certain aspects of negotiating the fine points of a deal, and while she let us know gently, she had our best interests at heart. Her endless supply of granola bars kept our children humming the whole time we were house hunting, and we loved the rapport both Traudel had with our children. Our daughter even explained to us one night over dinner that "real estate agents are the spice of life!" Dear Traudel, thank you for all your work in helping us find the right house for us—as soon as we are unpacked, you must come by! " - Aditi Menon ★★★★★ " The most important thing when working with a real estate agent is trust. We have been extremely lucky to have found Traudel Lange as our trusted real estate agent. As a European family we relocated to the US several years ago and moved back to Europe very recently. With Traudel’s excellent support we found the perfect home and we sold it when we moved back to Europe — even before it went on the market. Traudel very professionally and diligently guided us through the purchasing and selling process — always available, super-fast response times, great advice, very thorough knowledge of the Bethesda housing market, a real pleasure to work with. Thank you Traudel! " - Markus Repnik & Linda Klare ★★★★★ " Thank you so much for undertaking to manage the sale of my residence in Chevy Chase, DC, and the purchase of my new home. I can't tell you how much it means to me to be safe, happy and remaining among familiar faces and friends just a block and a half from my former home. Downsizing was a wise decision and you helped make it so. You eagerly came to a challenge in selling/buying a home on a timeline which met my needs. From the outset in our discussions, I sensed a person of high ethical standards. I was confident wise advice would guide me through a complicated process and everything legal and financial would be properly tended. You demonstrated an impressive knowledge of multiple neighborhoods, marketing/pricing, financial intricacies, staging and the ability to present complicated real estate concepts clearly and concisely. Your patience and diligence in answering questions are unsurpassed. Return of phone calls/reply to correspondence was unfailingly prompt. You have a wonderful capacity to both listen and understand a client's wants and needs and to help the two concepts gently meet. Always there was great attention to detail from beginning to end and beyond in making sure your client and new home were the best match. You are tireless in pursuit of the best interests of your client. I always felt you were working for me, part of which was helping me see the potential buyer's view, but always leaving me knowing the decision was mine and you would see it through with me regardless. Your assurances at every step of the way meant everything to me. The real estate profession I discovered is not for sissies. Yet I found an extraordinarily astute representative of charm, grace, kindness and uncompromising determination to do the very best for her client ... and succeed you did. Traudel, you are my Realtor for Life! Bless you and thank you, Traudel Lange. " - Ernest J. Pappajohn ★★★★★ " Traudel Lange is a consummate professional. She gave me great service when my husband and I wanted to downsize and sell our Cleveland Park home. I followed her staging advice, and a subsequent bidding war meant the house sold in 2009 for over the asking price. When it was time to buy again in fall 2013, she helped us uncover a smaller home for sale in another walkable DC neighborhood — Tenleytown/AU, across from green space, and a block from a playground, should we ever have grandchildren. She even visited me post-sale, advising which home improvements will pay off when we (or our heirs) sell again. I recommended her to a friend, who also had a successful sale, took the proceeds and bought in expensive San Francisco. I recommend her to you. " - Rachel Michaud ​​
title: Realtor/Real Estate Advisor

description: About Melissa Originally from Pennsylvania, Melissa has called the DC area home for more than 15 years. She pursued her passion for real estate by joining Team Koki a decade ago and became a Partner in 2023. Melissa’s commitment to long-term customer care was shaped during her previous career in the sports and entertainment industry. After completing her undergraduate degree at Elizabethtown College, Melissa worked in Sales & Marketing for various professional sports organizations including the Washington Wizards. However, once Melissa transitioned from sports and to real estate she knew she found her true passion. As a homeowner in Virginia and real estate investor in DC, Melissa has an in-depth local knowledge of the unique characteristics the DMV market presents. She is motivated day in and day out to be a dedicated advocate for her clients, ensuring they have a seamless buying and selling experience they will remember long after the transaction is complete. Melissa lives in Falls Church with her husband Mitch, an active duty military officer, and their two sons, Lincoln and Carter. In her free time, she enjoys attending her sons' sporting events, playing tennis, skiing, and traveling with her family.
title: Team Koki of Compass | Realtor®

description: About D'Ann A native Californian, D’Ann spent most of her professional career public . Among her former employers are United States Senate, the Department of Forestry Fire Protection (now CalFire) the of San Bernardino’s Mayor’s . Her background government relations, transportation planning come in handy when local municipalities including neighborhood associations on housing issues. D’Ann has Bachelor of Science degrees in economics environmental studies also holds a 's Degree Public Administration from State University.
title: Realtor

description: About Jacqueline Jacqueline’s enthusiasm for real estate is grounded in her belief that "A Beautiful Life Begins at Home". She represents sellers in DC and MD, specializing in probate sales and working with senior citizen sellers. Jacqueline is known for her integrity, as a trusted ally and being an advocate for her clients’ real estate goals and financial objectives. Jacqueline is supported by a team of professionals with decades of experience in the real estate industry. As a CPA with a background in public accounting, Jacqueline offers a detail-oriented skill set as well as decades of experience in real estate sales, home staging, REO project management, education and accounting services. Raised in the Midwest, Jacqueline has called Washington, DC and Montgomery County, MD home since 1985. She is a graduate of Howard University (BA) and the University of Akron (MPA). In her free time, you will find her outdoors, or engaged in a DIY project or affordable housing initiative.
title: REALTOR® | Licensed in DC & MD

description: About Laura Steuart Team The Laura Steuart Team of Compass is an award winning agent team, recognized by Washingtonian, Real Trends, and Trulia. With 28 years of real estate experience, her team understands every aspect of both the home buying and selling processes. Their priority is facilitating a successful and pleasant experience for their clients. Specializing in both buyer and seller services for the Washington DC metro area, Laura and the team’s experience in commercial and residential real estate in the District, Maryland, and Virginia ensures expertise across a range of price points, neighborhoods, and housing needs. Recognized by Washingtonian Magazine as "one of 99 people you need to know in Washington Real Estate," Laura is a third-generation real estate Associate Broker and has been licensed in the Washington, DC metro area for 28 years. She began her career in commercial real estate then transitioned into residential real estate in 2005 and has closed over $800 million in transactions. Laura has lectured on Real Estate Investment at her alma mater, Washington & Lee University in Lexington, Virginia, been interviewed about the Washington market The Washington Post, and frequently publishes articles on metro area real estate. She is also consistently recognized by Trulia and Realtrends as one of the top real estate agents in America.

About Elizabeth Elizabeth Lawson is a seasoned Real Estate Agent for Fleisher Arrowood of Compass, and licensed in Washington, DC, Maryland, and Virginia. Shortly after relocating to Washington, Elizabeth found her true passion in real estate, and her strong appreciation for DC’s architecture and urban design. As a top real estate team’s administrative, marketing and client associate for six years, she participated in successfully closing $400 million in sales for both buyers and sellers; including three record breaking sales within the DMV region in 2021 and 2022. Elizabeth’s unparalleled experience working alongside top agents contributes to her strong understanding of real estate best practices and evolving market knowledge, which she brings to each of her clients as their specialized real estate agent. Born and raised in Spartanburg, South Carolina with three sisters, Elizabeth brings her southern charm, personability, and seasoned perspective to connect with each client. Her passion to put others first establishes trust and confidence with her clients. From her personalized and meticulous, pre-launch and staging advice to her offer preparation and expert negotiation strategies, Elizabeth provides unwavering commitment to achieve the best results. Elizabeth received her Bachelor of Arts in History and a minor in Art History and International Global Studies from Sewanee: The University of the South in Tennessee, and her Paralegal Certificate from Georgetown University. She resides in Westmoreland Hills in Bethesda, MD with her husband, William, and their goldendoodle, Lyla. In her spare time, Elizabeth enjoys cooking, reading, hiking, traveling, and sporting events (Go Caps!), and is as active member of The Junior League of Washington, DC.
title: Realtor® | License in MD, DC & VA

description: About Jonathan My story. I grew up locally here in Montgomery County. As a kid, life wasn't always easy. There was a time in my life where I didn't have a home to call my own. I knew I'd rather not be a victim of my hard times and circumstances and I would make it a point to give back. I enlisted in the Army Reserve at the end of high school to help pay for my education at the University of Maryland Baltimore County. I worked in finance and helped run a nonprofit that helped Veterans obtain VA benefits. Wanting to get "out of the conference room" I decided to move into real estate. I began helping financial planning clients and friends with their real estate needs and it turned out that I really loved it! I enjoyed how relationship centric real estate is. It's allowed me to bond with people in a way financial planning didn't. I became addicted to the impact I could have on a person's life by telling them "you got the house!" or "we are under contract!". Everyone is so grateful that it never feels like work. Real estate allows me to be with my family more than ever. Chances are you are going to see Kinley when I drop off a sign or hear my son in the background while on a call. I hope they see my desire to help others and impacts them to want to do the same. Some fun things about me… I have attended over 200 live concerts. I’m a big Washington Wizards fan. I hate pickles. I love working out-HIIT, Crossfit, Running, Basketball. I told my wife Sarah I loved her after 2 weeks of dating. I served in the Army Reserve. I have been attacked by a shark (and won't go in the ocean anymore). I lived and worked in Seattle for a few years before deciding to move back to the East coast in 2006. I love coffee. I’m super competitive in everything, especially board games.
title: Realtor®

description: About Layne Residential Group Are you tired of every realtor saying the same thing? "I can sell your home for the most amount! I can help you buy a home under market!" It is tiresome. There are many realtors out there, but there aren't enough "experts". You may be a growing family that is looking to transition to that forever home or an empty nester who no longer needs all that space! First, I want to seek to understand what is going on in your life. There are many contributing factors that may be going on in your life that has gotten you this point. If you are a growing family, I know exactly what you're going through. I have two small children and I knew the importance of having permanent roots, the right school, and how the neighborhood would shape who they are. That being said I have worked with many clients over the years who are going through the opposite. They have raised their families, made memories, but now are looking to make new ones. The reasons may be different, but the need for an experienced expert that can navigate the transition remains the same.
title: Layne Residential Group of Compass

description: About Susan With 19 years of industry experience as a licensed realtor, Susan’s forte is pricing analysis and staging properties to get them for dollar in minimum time for sellers. For buyers, she is tenacious in finding the one cherry in the market full of prunes, and negotiating the best terms and most options at the lowest price. Susan speaks French, Italian, and conversational German. She specializes in SAIS alumni, World Bank, and State Department and foreign relocations to the area.
title: Vice President

description: About Jocelyn When Jocelyn Lederman first became a Realtor, she set out on a mission to prove that homeownership wasn’t just attainable, but a vital way to build financial security. Nine years later, the results speak for themselves: she’s helped over 140 clients find their dream home or get top dollar for their most prized investment. Now a dedicated Realtor, Jocelyn is every client’s advocate, guiding each with the knowledge they need to make the best decision for their future. Process- driven and committed to seamless communication, she works with buyers and sellers in all phases of life—from first-time home buyers overseas to tenured investors looking to expand their investment portfolio. Drawing from her previous career as a consultant, Jocelyn is skilled at finding creative solutions to even the most challenging roadblocks, while employing a healthy dose of humor that makes every client feel right at home. A DMV resident since 2009, Jocelyn is just as committed to her community as the clients she serves. Whether you’re looking to explore the daily rhythms of DC, Maryland, or Virginia, Jocelyn has the local insight you want on your side—wherever you may be in your journey to buy or sell. In her free time, Jocelyn is an avid cook determined to make the best bagels and pastrami in town. She loves discovering restaurants, new and old, as well as all the amazing shops, parks, and cultural attractions in and around DC. Jocelyn currently lives in the Cleveland Park neighborhood of NW DC with her wife, Ariel, and rescue pitbull, Donna.
title: Realtor

description: About Michael Michael is a native of the DC Metropolitan area and has a passion for helping people connect with the community. He draws upon the skills he as a teacher in the DC Public School system to educate his clients on the home-buying process, and he prides himself on being a good listener. When Michael is not working directly with clients, he makes an effort to preview as many homes as possible, both on-market and , so that he can provide a unique perspective beyond what clients can read listings and see in pictures online. With respect for each person’s unique preferences and comfort levels, he strives to help all of his clients find homes that they will be excited about for years to come, and do everything he can to ensure they have fun throughout the process.
title: Realtor®

description: About Kevin Kevin joined The Vassar Broermann Group in 2019 and is licensed in DC, Maryland, and Virginia. He earned his Masters degree from Johns Hopkins SAIS and his Bachelors from the University of Michigan. Prior to his real estate career, Kevin successfully owned and operated several businesses in the District, including the popular Duplex Diner in Adams Morgan. Kevin has lived in DC for more than 20 years and currently resides in Bethesda. Kevin prides himself on his transparency with his clients and attention to detail, earning their trust with his straightforward approach to his work. He strives to make the process of buying and selling a home an enjoyable and seamless experience for his clients, combining expertise and exceptional negotiating skills to consistently produce smooth transactions. Kevin has had multiple clients entrust him with the sale and purchase of their home while they were living overseas and works with many first-time homebuyers, guiding them through the process of looking for their first home. In his free time, Kevin enjoys gardening, cooking, and spending time outdoors hiking or walking with his husband and two dogs.
title: Realtor®

description: About Andreea Andreea Leu is a Principal Agent with Compass Real Estate. Licensed for nine years, she worked with some of the top regional brokers and teams before joining Compass in January 2022. Andreea has extensive experience working with both buyers and sellers to help them achieve their real estate goals. She recognizes and values the immense trust her clients place in her, and she strives to exceed their expectations and ensure that every transaction is a positive experience. Her strong work ethic, attention to detail, communication skills, and engaging personality have earned her many repeat clients. Andreea is a D.C.-area native who spent over a decade in Arlington, VA before relocating to Bloomingdale, where she lives with her fiancée, Paul, and their dog, Sasha. She earned a B.A. in psychology from George Mason University, which informs her keen insight into what buyers and sellers want. When she is not working, she enjoys running, exploring local restaurants and wineries, and baking (which engendered a thriving side business/passion project, Last Born Cakes). She also gives back to her community by volunteering for Lasagna Love, which provides home-cooked meals to local families in need.
title: Realtor®

description: About Rachel Rachel Levey is a Partner of District Property Group Compass, an elite team of agents who possess a diverse understanding of DC real estate - from buying and selling to development, property management, and leasing. As a DC area resident herself for over 37 years, Rachel is deeply familiar with DC's unique neighborhoods and surrounding suburbs. Clients find her first-hand experience extremely helpful when learning about the area's culture, development, and character. Rachel also serves as a powerful advocate, ensuring that each client is perfectly paired with real estate options that best meet the individual's needs. Her experience allows her to anticipate obstacles and preferences - resulting in exceptional service and results. Rachel's focused approach is paired with a creative, enthusiastic, and energetic attitude - guaranteeing that her clients feel confident and comfortable throughout the buying or selling process. She is a licensed Realtor in Washington, DC, Maryland, and Virginia, and holds a BA from the University of Maryland. Rachel and her husband Brian reside in the Palisades with their three children.
title: Vice President

description: About Jillian Stringer Jillian (Stringer) Levitt, is a DMV native and has been a DC resident since 2013. After six successful years in software sales, Jillian made the transition to real estate after buying her first property in DC. Her primary focus is to help each client achieve their property goals, whether it is navigating the market to buy their perfect home or selling their home at the highest possible price. In every interaction, Jillian brings a perfect blend of professionalism and warmth, ensuring that every client feels heard and supported. With Jillian by your side, you can trust that your real estate journey will be guided by a knowledgeable expert who truly cares about your needs and aspirations. Jillian and her husband, Joel, along with their adorable puppy, Cooper, and energetic two-year-old, Chase, call Petworth in Washington, DC home. When she's not working, she can be found trying new restaurants or doing Pilates. Jillian also contributes to her community by serving on several boards and non-profits. Whether you are a first-time homebuyer or a seasoned seller, Jillian's dedication, local expertise, and commitment to client satisfaction make her the ideal partner for your real estate needs.
title: Licensed Real Estate Salesperson

description: About Steven About Steven Steven is a lifelong Washingtonian with deep roots in the city and a career built on service, market knowledge, and strategic guidance. Born and raised in Tenleytown, he is a graduate of St. John’s College High School and went on to earn dual bachelor’s degrees in Business Administration and Mandarin Chinese from the University of Pittsburgh. He later returned to his hometown to complete his MBA at American University. As a Realtor, Steven combines his business acumen with an insider’s understanding of the DC metro area. He approaches every client relationship with a commitment to professionalism, transparency, and results. His knowledge of neighborhood trends, market dynamics, and property values across the DMV allows him to position homes effectively and advocate for his clients with confidence. Steven’s passion for real estate is matched by his connection to the community. As a lifelong supporter of DC’s teams and neighborhoods, he brings the perspective of someone who not only works here—but lives and invests here. When clients choose to work with Steven, they gain a trusted advisor who is detail-oriented, market-savvy, and fully committed to helping them achieve their real estate goals.
title: Realtor®

description: About Lex Lianos & Associates With more than 50 years of combined experience, Lex Lianos & Associates is a highly successful real estate team, staffed by agents passionate about positively impacting the lives of those we serve by helping achieve their goals and dreams. In 2017 alone LL&A helped over 190 families with their real estate needs; it is a privilege to represent each of them.

About Lex Lex Lianos is an award winning, top producing Realtor. He and his team are committed to helping their clients buy and sell houses with the greatest outcome and least amount of stress. Lex’s strong work ethic, multifaceted interests and history of success in all areas of his life have led him to be adaptable, creative, and always striving for the best. After graduating from Boston University with a B.A. in Economics and minor in Business Administration, Lex embarked on an eight-year adventure as a professional musician, appearing on major label album releases, in an MTV music video, appearing in the top 10 on Billboard’s Modern Rock Charts, and touring the US and Europe. Both real estate and music were passions from an early age, and having found success with one, Lex decided to further pursue the other. He joined Metro Realty in Brookline, MA in 1996 and became the managing partner in 1999. Two years later, he was named “Best Realtor” in Boston Magazine’s annual Best of Boston issue. He and his wife moved to Virginia In 2007, and he became affiliated with Weichert Realtor’s Vienna office. Prior to joining Compass, Lex was the #1 Weichert agent in the capital region for three of four sales categories tracked (Sales, Resales, and New Homes). Since then, Lex has steadily increased his business and surrounded himself with some stellar people along the way. In 2013, he started Lex Lianos and Associates. 2018 started a new chapter for the team as they joined Compass, the fastest growing, most innovative brokerage in the country. Compass takes a tech-driven, personalized approach to buying and selling your home, combining a collaborative agent community, in-house creative agency, and the industry’s most tenured leadership team. Lex loves helping people in general, but he particularly enjoys helping them with their real estate needs. Serving people and guiding clients through the buying and selling process is something he is passionate about, and he’s just as committed to helping his teammates grow both professionally and personally. Lex and his team are always eager to help their clients buy and sell their homes with the best outcome, keeping stress at a minimum and even making the process fun! Lex lives in Vienna, VA, with Sheila, his wife of 25 years, their daughter Sophia, and Buddy, their Boston terrier. www.lexlianos.com
title: Founding Agent, Executive VP

description: About Ed After Ed retired from his work in government, he dedicated himself to full-time real estate sales and property management. Using his experiences in sales, marketing, and management, Ed commits himself to providing each client with outstanding service.
title: Realtor®

description: About Toby Toby is the team lead and Principal of the Treasury Homes Team . Having the right real estate agent means having an agent who is committed to helping you buy or sell your home with the highest level of expertise in your local market. This means also working to help you in understanding each step of the buying or selling process. This commitment level has helped Toby build a remarkable track record of delivering results. Nothing is more exciting to him than the gratifying feeling he gets from helping people meet their real estate needs. You can count on Toby to always do what’s in your best interest. He prides himself on being honest, trustworthy, and knowledgeable in the real estate market. He knows how important it is to find your dream home or get the best offer for your home. Therefore he will make it his responsibility to help you achieve those goals. Whether you are an experienced investor or a first time buyer, Toby can help you in finding the home of your dreams. Please feel free to browse his website or let him guide you every step of the way by calling or emailing him to set up an appointment today. TreasuryHomesDMV.com <br>
title: Realtor®

description: About George Hello and welcome! Thank you so much for exploring these pages of my website. I hope you find the content here useful and informative. Here is a little bit about me. I am a full-time REALTOR having just joined Compass and I am licensed in the District of Columbia and Maryland. I have been in real estate sales for over 10 years and I enjoy helping clients fulfill their real estate goals. My expertise includes helping purchasers navigate the home buying process and helping sellers to best present their homes for maximum return through staging and design consultation. I also have extensive knowledge of the short-term rental business and I'm able to advise real estate entrepreneurs on getting the most out of their investment properties. I am a member of the National Association of REALTORS (NAR), The District of Columbia Association of REALTORS (DCAR) and the Greater Capital Area Association of REALTORS (GCAAR). Prior to entering real estate, I enjoyed a enjoyed a successful career in television and media last serving as Vice President of Affiliate Sales & Marketing for TV One, an entertainment and lifestyle network. I also spent several years working in affiliate sales at Discovery Networks (Discovery Channel, TLC, Animal Planet). I am a graduate of Brown University and I'm involved in the Brown Alumni Association of Washington, DC. I've been a resident of the District of Columbia for over 20 years and love living in the nation's capitol. I live in the Hill East neighborhood on Capitol Hill in a multi-unit home that includes a successful Airbnb that I enjoy managing as well as hosting guests from around the world. In my personal time, I enjoy tennis, skiing, bicycling, gardening, and taking long walks with my dog Sonny. Whether you've found this page through an email, social media channels, or you were referred here by a friend, I'm happy to have you as my guest and here to assist with your real estate plans.
title: Realtor® | Licensed in DC, VA & MD

description: About Elisabeth Elisabeth, born in Brazil, moved from Brazil to Germany and has now made the greater Washington DC area her home. Buying her very first own home inspired her to become a real estate agent and to support her clients in such an important moment. An engineer by trade with experience in finance and sales, she gathered a variety of skills that will be at your service all steps of the way, from beginning to end in finding and purchasing your new home. Client Testimonials ★★★★★ " Elisabeth has been the best first time home buying agent I could've asked for. She has been very great at communicating, filling in plenty of gaps, and has been great at answering any of questions I've raised. I highly recommend her to anyone trying to purchase property in DC! " ★★★★★ " Elisabeth is kind, fun, honest, and incredibly helpful. She is great at her job because of this and because she is a fantastic listener. She gave us recommendations based on what we were looking for and ended up finding the perfect fit for our really specific needs. She responded quickly and was patient through the entire, complicated process of purchasing our home. I highly recommend working with her! " ★★★★★ " Very knowledgeable about the area and quickly developed a great understanding of what I was looking for. She independently made the effort to find places that fit my parameters and every place she recommended was a good option. Responsive over both text and email, and was able to move very quickly to put offers on hot properties. Also provided great advice about what price and terms to offer, including patiently explaining the finer points of contingencies and what those meant for me. Also just a nice, easy to talk to person to interact with while viewing properties! " ★★★★★ " We met Elisabeth 2 years ago when she showed us several properties and represented us in a sales offer on a condo. We were very impressed with her expertise but, more importantly her honesty and easy going attitude. We called her recently when another condo caught our eye and she helped us make an offer and purchase it. Elisabeth is EXTREMELY responsive and efficient and got back to us with every single enquiry immediately. She is a gem and I would highly recommend her to my closest friends and family without reservation. " ★★★★★ " I highly recommend Elisabeth in the fast-paced DC market. She is excellent and detail-oriented. Elisabeth made my home purchase way less stressful, informative, and fun. I had a great experience purchasing my first condo in DC with her: comparing various houses and apartments, understanding the market, putting together competitive offers. I have also received some great tips about mortgage, property taxes and even interior design and house pets from her. " ​
title: Mollaan Babbington Group | Realtor® DC | MD | VA

description: About Amanda Amanda has been a licensed real estate professional for over 9 years and is known for her dedication, integrity, compassion, and loyalty to the client. Her professional and personal experiences have provided her with tremendous organizational and interpersonal skills, which she implements daily. Amanda dedicates herself to client relations with her attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills helping to propel buyers and sellers to settlement. Amanda lives in beautiful Potomac, Maryland with her active son, a rescue dog named Juicy, and a plump little Pug named Jerry. You may find her cheering on her son’s team at a lacrosse game, hitting golf balls at the range, doing yoga, or hiking along the Potomac River. With a keen intuition and deep gratitude for life's ups and downs, she is the perfect person to have by your side during one of life's biggest milestones.
title: Realtor®

description: About Randy “The real estate industry, especially over the last 5 years, has experienced immense pressure to innovate and change. I’m focused on evolving to keep pace with the industry as well as continually improving as an agent. In order to be the best resource for my clients, I have to examine what I do that’s what isn’t. There’s no ego any of this.” Born and raised in the city of ‘brotherly love’, Philadelphia, Randy brings a no-nonsense, yet caring and genuine approach to clients. Growing as a gymnast - both as a student, and later a coach, Randy’s work ethic reflects that sports required dedication and rigor, ensuring his clients receive the personalized, nuanced stellar experience they deserve. “I work tirelessly to earn the trust of my clients. This business is built on relationships. Everyone wants to close more deals, but the core of my work and what I do is focused on the quality of each transaction, not the quantity.” Randy graduated honors from Fielding University, earning his Masters in Organizational Management . Always looking for new challenges and ways build his arsenal of skills, in 2015 Randy passed the notoriously difficult Project Management Professional exam to earn his PMP. A resident of DC 17 years, Randy has worked leadership roles managing large teams at Bank of America, Apple, and Pottery Barn. His skill set reflects that experience, whether he is reviewing lender estimates for nervous first-time buyers, selecting inventory staging for property sellers, or partnering with developer clients to incorporate smart tech into new construction. Randy is a tireless advocate of animal rights and supports both national organizations such as the ASPCA as well as local rescue efforts like City Dogs. You will find him, his partner Daren Phillips, and their dog Sadie, an Anatolian Shepherd mix, at the dog at 17th & New Hampshire strolling Meridian Hill Park. His hobbies are mainly centered on music. “My first instrument was drums. I played in a band school/college. In 2006 I bought a guitar and taught myself play. If I could get a band together, life would near perfect. We’ll see what the next few years have in store! Stay tuned!” Randy is licensed in DC and VA.
title: Realtor® | Senior Vice President

description: About Robert Starting in real estate in 1995 has afforded Robert not only exemplary knowledge of the industry but an impeccable reputation for outstanding service and results. Beginning in the Baltimore market for nine years and, subsequently, the DC market, Robert is a full-service professional holding DC, Maryland & Virginia licenses. With a particular focus on sales and rentals inside the Beltway, his expertise runs the gamut: first-time buyers, long-time homeowners, large corporation executives, World Bank staffers, and embassy appointees, to name a few. Regardless of property type, he's adept at orchestrating even the most complex contract negotiations. As a seasoned agent, Robert is well liked and well connected within the DC area brokerage community which gives him a distinct advantage as an industry favorite, deal-maker and networker. Fluent in both Spanish and English, Robert was born and raised in Panama where he learned the ropes of real estate assisting his mother who was in the business at the time. While he has lived in Sarasota, Florida as well as throughout the DC suburbs, Robert has called The District home since 2004 and has lived in two of its four jurisdictions. Prior to real estate, Robert worked in the travel industry. In his spare time, he remains an avid traveler as well as a car fanatic and gardening enthusiast. Designations - GRI (Graduate REALTOR® Institute) National Association of REALTORS® Maryland Association of REALTORS®
title: Realtor®

description: About Peter Striking a Chord in Real Estate... The bad news was that Peter Locker’s guitar instructor, the man who shaped him into an accomplished classical musician, was leaving the area. The good news was that he was going to arrange an audition for Peter with Aaron Shearer, the director of the guitar department at the renowned Peabody Conservatory of Music. Naturally, Peter was thrilled. He had been studying guitar since age 11 when his late father’s guitar was handed down to him by one of his three older brothers. Now the 19-year-old faced the most important performance of his life. When the day finally came, Peter was ready. He played one piece, a study by 18th century guitarist/composer Fernando Sor. When he finished playing, Mr. Shearer walked over and struck a string with his index finger producing a sound of booming resonance that Peter had never heard from his guitar. Peter panicked. What had I missed all these years? Would it mean starting from scratch? "Just refinement," Shear assured him. At the end of the audition, Mr. Shearer encouraged him to move to Baltimore for more intense study. Rising To The Challenge On many levels Peter did have to start from scratch. As a result, his appreciation for classical music grew profoundly. He initially took four lessons a week and his talents developed wonderfully. Peter learned many lessons under Shear's tutelage, but none had more impact than this: thorough knowledge and training allow intuition and emotions to flow appropriately. The actual plucking of the guitar strings reaches the highest level of musicianship only when considered with the finer details. The alignment of the body. The position of the wrist. The precise combination of fingernail and finger that touches the strings to create just the right tone. These are the greater things that separate a real musician from "just a guitarist."And these are the points that struck a chord in Peter's mind. An Important Turning Point After five years of study in Baltimore, Peter came to an important realization: only a hand full of classical guitarists make it as performers and, although he was very good, a virtuoso career was probably out of his reach. Rather, Peter decided to look for an arena in which his newfound appreciation for the finer details could be melded with his sincere desire to work with others. Knowledge and intuition would be transposed to another profession. Finding His Niche Peter‘s grandfather had made his mark in the world through real estate in Manhattan and Peter had always been intrigued by that vocation. Thus, it was a natural fit for him: he was a lifelong resident of the area and he saw an opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives. Real estate, he knew, would draw on his knowledge and intuition . Today, more than 4 decades later, Peter never regrets the day he made that decision. Like Shearer did with him, Peter has been able to strike a chord with his neighbors helping them with real estate decisions – making that important difference. Still Striking Chords Peter still loves to play guitar. In fact, time away from the real estate often finds him engrossed in striking the right chordson one of his three beautiful instruments, including two handmade seven string concert guitars. "Music is the perfect respite from my real estate career." he says. "I feel very fortunate to have that balance in my life." Results That Sing Peter is quick to point out that while playing guitar is still a passion,he is equally passionate about his clients achieving the results they deserve. In fact, Peter views selling real estate as another art form by focusing on the right details in attaining results. "I like to think of my clients as patrons of the arts when buying and selling real estate through me," jests Peter. Whether your personal real estate goals entail buying or selling, moving up or down, Peter is confident he can strike a beautiful chord in your life. And that’s music to anyone’s ears.
title: Realtor®

description: About Deirdre I’m Deirdre “DeeDee” Lofft. I was raised in Bethesda, graduated from Georgetown Visitation, and was a police officer in Alexandria. So, I guess you could say I’m a well-rounded Washingtonian with knowledge of the entire area. I can help you navigate the complex local markets with trust and confidence and get you the most bang for your buck. I have also managed everything from full renovations to quick fixer-uppers and have a team of skilled contractors at the ready to prep any home for sale. So, if you're looking to buy or sell in Bethesda, Chevy Chase, or D.C., or you simply want to know how much you home is worth, contact me anytime.
title: Realtor®

description: About Alex I bring an unparalleled depth of market knowledge to every transaction, informed by more than 46 years of living and working in the Washington, D.C. area. Whether assisting first-time buyers, seasoned homeowners, or sophisticated investors, I am committed to helping you achieve your homeownership goals with expertise and integrity. While buying or selling a home can often feel daunting, my role is to ensure the process is as seamless and empowering as possible. Grounded in a strong understanding of the financial underpinnings of real estate, I pair analytical insight with advanced marketing and technological strategies to position properties for optimal success. I remain at the forefront of innovation, leveraging social media, digital marketing, and emerging technologies, while also staying current with the evolving landscape of real estate law, principles, and market dynamics. My aim is not only to represent you in a transaction but to provide you with the confidence and clarity necessary to make informed decisions in today’s complex real estate environment.
title: Realtor® in VA, DC, & MD

description: About Laura Laura and her team of P&rtners have again been named a Top Team by the Washingtonian and the Wall Street Journal and are one of the top teams at Compass DC/Maryland/Virginia. As a premier real estate agent, her approachable manner coupled with her extensive knowledge and professional energy have placed her and her team of P&rtners in the top echelon of all agents in her area. Having grown up in the DC area and worked in the market for many years, she uses her in depth knowledge of the area to best position her buyers and sellers for success. Laura has a client centric approach, ensuring each client is informed and comfortable with the process, even in such a hot and fast-paced market. With a background in the performing arts, Laura has been employed at some of the most notable arts institutions in the DC, including the Embassy Series, Washington Performing Arts, and the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. Through this work, combined with her experience in real estate, Laura has honed her approach as well as the art of competitive negotiating, helping people through one of the most significant decisions of their lives. This combined with her direct manner with her clients and with other agents ensures a productive and rewarding experience for all involved. She stays active in the DC community, not only through sales, but through boards and other endeavors. Laura sits on the Alumni Board of Georgetown Day School, participates in Many Hands Giving Circle, and is the former Chair of the Board of Dupont Underground . Laura practices real estate in DC, Maryland and Virginia. View Laura's Video Bio

description: About Zack Born and raised in Northern Virginia, Zack has kept his focus on the DC area, earning a degree from Virginia Commonwealth University with a focus on creative writing. Having spent years in fine furniture design and woodworking, he has a unique and experienced eye for quality and precision, and his practiced approach to identifying a client’s preferences and desires translates perfectly into the real estate landscape. A childhood interest in construction and architecture is rekindled in Zack through an entry into realty, and as a member of the Compass team, he is proud and excited to take part in expanding the stories of the people in his community, one home at a time.
title: REALTOR®

description: About Steve As a long time resident of Washington, DC and a native of Maryland, Steve has a deep understanding of how neighborhoods in our growing metropolitan area change, expand, and become home. With over 16 years of experience in real estate, Steve remains committed to finding the best for his clients by helping them to identify the place that is right for them both today and in the future. Steve has deep connections with developers and homeowners around Washington. He promises to put those connections to work for you as he keeps his clients informed about new construction and properties not yet on the market. Thanks to many years of work in the hospitality industry, Steve is comfortable not only advising you on the home buying and selling process, but also on local restaurants to check out in your new neighborhood and what bottle of wine to bring home to celebrate when deals are done. Steve continually exceeds client expectations with his dedicated, individualized service. He will enthusiastically work to address all of your concerns, questions, and excitement when it comes to buying or selling your home. Whether you want to meet for coffee, a meal or spin class, he is there to talk through the big decisions while enjoying the small ones along the way.

About Lauren Lauren has routinely been recognized as one of the top agents in the DMV having helped nearly 400 families buy and sell. Lauren’s dedication to customer service and her expertise in the local market have helped her build a thriving business built on client referrals so you can rest assured knowing Lauren is focused on serving you, her client, and she’s not wasting precious time prospecting for new clients. Lauren has received numerous awards recognizing her sales acumen; including being featured in DC Metro Real Producers top 40 under 40, The Washingtonian's Top Agents, and Arlington Magazine's Top Real Estate Producers. Clients choose Lauren for her insight into the market, strong negotiation skills, and attention to detail. Clients also love that Lauren's able to find homes before they even go on market; a testament to her proactiveness and diligence. Outside of work, Lauren loves spending time with family, especially her husband, Bryan, and two children Connor and Mackenzie. She also enjoys hiking and volunteering in the local community. Whether you’re a first-time buyer, an investor, or ready to move on to your next home, Lauren will work hard to ensure you win your next home because she knows that home is where your family’s memories will be made. When the time is right, please contact Lauren and let her help make your home buying process stress-free, fun, and rewarding.
