Ultimately, Kate cherishes any time spent with amazing people, delicious food, picturesque landscapes, and the purest joy that animals bring. In every aspect of her life, Kate exudes a professional yet friendly demeanor. Her warm and approachable nature instantly puts clients at ease, fostering a sense of trust and open communication. With her unwavering dedication and commitment to excellence, Kate goes above and beyond to meet the real estate needs of her community.
title: Realtor®

description: About Karl Karl’s real estate team motto is Trusted. Transparent. Always on your side. As an Eagle Scout, Karl knows a scout is first and foremost trustworthy. With an unwavering loyalty to his clients’ best interests, Karl is committed to achieving the best outcomes for them while offering guidance and sterling service every step of the way. His goal is to make his clients feel safe, seen, and heard, and create space and ease for them to enjoy the experience. With 11 years of executive-level, client-facing experience, he has a proven track record of listening for his clients’ needs and staying eagle-eyed for ways to provide value. Karl is eager to bring his trust, compassion, business acumen, negotiating skills, disarming nature, and diplomacy to your next real estate purchase, sale, or investment. Karl is originally from Madison, WI and has proudly called NW DC (Columbia Heights & Adams Morgan) home since 2014. A graduate of the University of Wisconsin-Madison, Karl is trilingual in Spanish and Portuguese.
title: Realtor® | Licensed in DC, MD. & VA

description: About Phyllis Working in the close-in areas of Montgomery County and DC, Phyllis has listed and sold some of the most beautiful homes in the DC metro area. A native Washingtonian, she brings a lifelong knowledge of the area to her work. Clients are drawn to her market savvy and value her as a trusted advisor. Whether representing a first-time buyer or a seller of a luxury property, Phyllis is hands-on and deeply involved. Clients tell her that they sleep better at night knowing she will guide them and look out for their interests - every step of the way. Her commitment to her clients and her “above and beyond” service has garnered her numerous awards, repeat business and many referrals. Phyllis brings research, evaluation and management experience, gained from her work with both the DC and Federal governments and the non-profit arts organization, the historic Lincoln Theatre, to her career in real estate. Phyllis is very active in her community and is currently Chair of the Town of Somerset Welcome Committee, Platinum sponsor of the Somerset Elementary School Foundation, and has served as Chair of the Town’s Board of Supervisors of Elections. She is the founding President of the B-CC High School Educational Foundation.
title: Realtor® Licensed in MD & DC
Realtor® licensed in DC, MD & VA

description: About Deborah Deborah is a dedicated real estate professional with the award-winning Wiesenfelder Group of Compass. Having grown up going to open houses and touring neighborhood homes with her mother, this was a natural career fit. Deborah brings over 20 years of corporate retail savvy to her practice of real estate. Deborah’s passion for and experience in the home furnishings industry provides her with a keen eye for how a prospective house can become a client’s dream home. Combined with her ability to collaborate and deft negotiation skills honed through years of product development, this passion offers her clients the most well-rounded real estate advisor as they make one of the biggest financial decisions of their lives. Deborah is a second-generation Washingtonian, having attended Somerset, Westland, and B-CC High School, where she played on the State Championship Field Hockey Team. After graduating from Emory University in Atlanta and living in New York City, Deborah moved back to the Town of Somerset, where she had grown up, with her family. When she is not working with her mom and brother, Deborah cherishes spending time with her husband, two children, friends, and extended family. She actively contributes to her community as the Co-Chair of the Gan Parents Association at her children's pre-school and helps organize neighborhood events in the Town of Somerset.
title: Realtor® | Licensed in MD, DC & VA

description: About Safari Nichole Safari Nichole, Washington DC native who has unrivaled knowledge of the area, epitomizes creativity, hard-work, and integrity in every aspect of her life. She provides a White Glove experience across all markets. She stands apart namely because of her care for her clients, strong negotiation abilities, and her interior design influence. Safari Nichole understands that every transaction is unique, which is why she provides a tailored approach specifically for each client. Her true passion is teaching people how to use real estate as a vehicle to create multi generational financial stability. As a Certified International Property Specialist, she is able to help clients navigate complex transitions both internationally and domestically. With her formal interior design education and a deep love for marketing, Safari maximizes these skills to effectively market properties. While positioning the property to get the maximum exposure, she is also able to offer her clients luxury staging. She takes pride in developing and nurturing her invaluable network, and she has a deep appreciation for her esteemed clients. Adjectives that properly describe her are professional, communicative, proactive, and reliable! Safari prioritizes community service, and has a warm heart for helping families with estate planning. When she isn’t working, you can find her spending time with her family, traveling, and moonlighting as a socialite. Interior Designer Certified International Property Specialist
title: Realtor®

description: About Mica Native to the DMV I have lived in many neighborhoods throughout the district and Eastern Maryland. I have a great appreciation and understanding for the city’s diversity, culture, and architectural integrity, and my practical knowledge of each neighborhood is what makes me excel in matching people with properties. Washington may seem a bit overwhelming and somewhat of a condensed metropolis, but those familiar with the city know it to be comprised of an extremely wide variety of people as well as neighborhoods. That is why it’s so important to find an agent who has experience with all of the city’s different “personalities” and can help guide you toward the best location for your needs, likes and lifestyle.
title: REALTOR®

description: About Jaime Jaime is a native Michigander who fell in love with the nation’s capital and is proud to call it home. She's leveraged her law degree, professional coaching certification, education work, and a passion for real estate into one holistic package for her clients—finding the perfect home in a neighborhood that meets their needs. As a former AmeriCorps volunteer for Habitat for Humanity, where she helped build a 100 home neighborhood post Hurricane Andrew, she has a keen eye for a home’s potential and loves finding unique solutions to interesting homeowner challenges. She first moved to Washington, DC, in 2000 to attend Georgetown Law School, graduating in 2003 and passing the NY Bar the same year. In the past twenty five plus years in the DC area, she's lived in Silver Spring, Adams Morgan, Bloomingdale, Columbia Heights, Petworth, Forest Glen, and Takoma DC. Jaime thrives on working with thoughtful, curious clients who appreciate a data-driven approach, clear communication, and strategic decision-making. Her Ideal clients value expertise, seek to be well-informed, and trust in a collaborative process—whether they’re first-time buyers, sellers navigating their next chapter, or policy-minded professionals making a smart move. Jaime balances market insights with deep empathy, ensuring that every client feels heard, prepared, and empowered. The goal isn’t just to close deals—it’s to ensure that a year down the road, clients still feel great about their choices, their investment, and their home. With a commitment to putting people over transactions and anticipating client needs to keep the process as smooth as possible, Jaime is the agent of choice for those who want a knowledgeable and client-focused real estate experience. She genuinely loves her work, and a lot of her free time is spent on work-related research projects. But if she's not working, she enjoys being politically engaged—election nights are her Super Bowl, and she walked down the aisle to The West Wing theme song. She loves traveling and has currently visited 48 US States and 23 Countries and counting. She's a very proud aunt to six nephews and five nieces and works hard to earn the distinction of being “fiercely loyal” to her closest friends and family. She lives in Takoma DC, with her husband, Benjamin, a federal government IT programmer, and their three rescue cats in a home they "finished" renovating in 2024 (the project list doesn't ever really end, does it?). Client Testimonials ★★★★★ " We have just completed the process of selling our family home and I am compelled to give my review of how the process went. First, and foremost, Jaime is the most proficient and professional agent that I have worked with. I am a retired and Urban Designer that has worked both nationally and internationally and know that the buying and selling process can result in high amounts of stress." " Jaime was far beyond what most will do in this process. She did the research on our property before we actually contracted with her to sell the property. Once we were formally engaged she handled everything related to clearing the house of furniture, keeping us informed with regular updates on every action that we needed to do as sellers, and was incredibly knowledgeable of the neighborhood that I have lived in for over 50 years." " The neighborhood that I live in has always been a desired location in Washington DC and when word got out that we were selling the house there were a plethora of attempting to represent our family. Jaime was far beyond what other were proposing. I live across the street from the property that we were selling, which provided an excellent opportunity to observe her actions in showing the house. She was just amazingly flawless and so on point with everything that needed to be done." " Jaime’s professional interpersonal skills makes it very easy to talk with her…she listens exceptionally well and gives solid feed-back that effectively presents options for our consideration. When engaging with her it’s like she is a member of our family with the objective of representing and protecting our interests and desires. More importantly, she understands the nuance vibe of the neighborhood which enabled her to effectively present the property to potential buyers (over 100 people looked at the house)." " I must also mention that she completed all of what was necessary to do to sell the property within six months during the Fall and Winter in the middle of the Covid-19 pandemic.. simply amazing. I would highly recommend securing Jaime’s services if anyone was interested in selling or buying property. I have given out all of her cards that I had to both my friends and professional associates…even while on the golf course! Finally, I have to also mention that Jaime and KVS Title worked so well together that there was simply no stress in the process…it reminded me of a symphonic harmony." -David H. ★★★★★ " I want to write the most amazing review for simply one of the most gifted and brilliant realtors you will ever have the pleasure to work with when finding the home of your dreams. My fear is anyone who reads this will think Jaime Willis paid me to do it! She did not, lol." " I needed to find an adorable and peaceful home for me and my mentally challenged, yet lovable dog, Sammy. I was living in Massachusetts when the search began and did not have the time nor the inclination to travel down to DC to find it. I trusted Jaime sooooo much we made an offer on a Bungalow in MD, right across the DC border, sight unseen (well me!). She negotiated a better price for me, and she worked beautifully with the seller's agent. Nothing ever felt difficult, or stressful for me, but I know it must have been incredibly challenging for Jaime during the Covid-19 era to make multiple trips to the property without me, and to know that her client was entrusting and expecting her to make decisions so that I could focus on other critical matters in my life. Imagine that stress when half a million bucks is on the line? Jaime took on the challenge with grace and kindness." " Before the closing she made sure my home was professionally cleaned (who does that?!), she helped me find the right alarm system, she installed (herself!) a NEST thermostat so I could control my home's HVAC remotely cause I travel often, she bought a cute dog bowl for my pooch, and put soap and other supplies in my bathrooms. She even had my lawn mowed so it looked extra posh. I mean, come on, who does these things? Jaime Willis DOES!!" " Jaime is highly intelligent, an attorney training, with real estate acumen second to none. She made it fun, exciting, and meaningful. You will not only fall in love with your new home if you work with Jaime, you will fall in love with her! I am gay so I can say that, lol." " Jaime thank you from the bottom of my heart for making this single dog dad happier than he could have ever imagined." " As for those reading this, Jaime, in two words, is a saintly star. -Scott S
title: Realtor - Licensed in DC, MD, and VA

description: About Will As a native Washingtonian, Will grew up in the historic Mount Pleasant neighborhood, attending Edmund Burke School. He later received his undergraduate degree from Virginia Commonwealth University and a graduate degree from Brandeis University. Will began his career with Homeland Security and later worked in financial services with JP Morgan Chase and Merrill Lynch. His time at both organizations taught him patience, attention to detail, and the importance of developing trust with his clients. In 2016, Will directed his interests to residential sales, putting his extensive knowledge of his birth city to work for his clients. Whether his clients are searching for a single-family home, condo, or an investment opportunity, Will guides his clients through every step of the real estate transaction. He is known for always putting his clients first- taking time to ensure his clients are educated on the local real estate market and are informed to make the best decisions possible. In his spare time, Will enjoys traveling abroad, watching scary movies, and exploring the District's dynamic restaurant scene. He is also a proud supporter of FONZ (Friends of the National Zoo).
title: Realtor® licensed in DC

description: About Nikki In taking every measure to help her clients successfully accomplish their real estate goals, Nikki Wilson provides outstanding expertise and professional representation with a personal touch. As a member of The Mollaan Group, her knowledge and enthusiasm for the distinctive communities within The Greater DC real estate market is very present as she caringly shares her valued counsel. Specializing in the Acquisition and Marketing of Residential, Luxury, and Investment Properties, together with Developer Services, Nikki clearly distinguishes herself by executing on behalf of her clients with very deliberate, strategic, and skillful measures that achieve impressive results. Nikki is infectiously passionate about real estate. In personally working with each client and upon understanding their specific priorities, she then diligently aligns and applies herself in order to accomplish their real estate goals. She is highly meticulous in covering every angle and providing her clients with the critical information needed to make thoughtful and balanced decisions. Whether it is educating first-time buyers on each step of the home buying process, a review of the contractual components of the transaction or doing diligence on issues cited in the title report; Nikki is highly attentive in serving the specific requirements of her clients. Nikki’s warm and friendly personality is very present in everything she does on behalf of her clients and it is truly her joy to ultimately fulfill their request throughout the transaction. Through her genuine dedication and commitment to serving each client with true advocacy, they always receive real estate advice based on a careful analysis of the market. Her clients enjoy her personal touches and find her to be honest, knowledgeable about every detail and quick to find solutions. Her immediate accessibility, answers to timely questions and trusted perspective, is all part of Nikki’s distinguished style in providing exceptional representation and outstanding personal service. Contact Nikki to serve you and your personal real estate interests.
title: Mollaan Babbington Group | Realtor®

description: About John John lives in the North Ridge neighborhood of Alexandria City with his wife and three young daughters. John is a board member of the North Ridge Citizens Association. With over 17 years of sales and sales management experience, his negotiating skills will ensure you win your next real estate negotiation. If a local property is on the market, John has toured it! He strives to tour each and every property in his local market so that you will directly benefit from his direct knowledge of each property. John is a true expert when it comes to the neighborhoods, their restaurants, and their attractions that make for a great place to live and experience. With a sales background spanning the automotive industry, insurance, government contracting, and the building industry, he can assure the wide-ranging skills benefit his clients in many unique aspects. John also boasts extensive experience restoring historic antebellum homes, building luxury homes, and land development- all of which started with his own personal portfolio of properties. By age 21, John had already negotiated and closed his first multi-million dollar deal in the building industry. John can walk any property and provide you with all the proper information you need to make a smart and informed decision. He utilizes a plethora of sales and marketing techniques to ensure the most profitable transaction. From conversing with neighbors to the latest social media trends- John uses proven methods and experiments with the latest in order to provide you with the best. John’s career began in Alexandria City and he’s built a massive customer base that ensures his clients will sell their home faster and find their next home faster while receiving truly outstanding customer service. He works primarily on a referral basis and strives to ensure that every client will recommend him to their friends and family. This also provides his clients with unparalleled access to off-market properties and a wide variety of buyers for their homes. Contact John today to discover why he is your greatest asset before, during, and after your unique real estate transaction.
title: Realtor®

description: About Rick Rick Woler, a Vice President and Realtor at Compass, licensed in DC/MD/VA, began his real estate career as Trent & Co.’s Transaction Coordinator. Through this role, he played a part in more than 400 real estate transactions totaling more than $300 million in sales spanning the greater DC Metro Area. This unique experience has proven to be an invaluable asset in developing him into an effective agent who will go the extra mile for his clients. Since assuming his role as a sales agent in 2019, Rick has closed 200+ transactions totaling $130+ million in total sales volume. Rick sees each client individually and is able to meet them where they are in their buying or selling journey, whether it’s their first property or they are seasoned homeowners. Whether you're getting ready to sell your home or looking for an investment, your forever home, or anything in between, Rick will work diligently to help you make it happen. He considers multiple approaches to any problem and helps his clients choose the one that best suits their needs so they can successfully navigate the fast-paced, ever-changing world of DC real estate together. Rick joined the Trent & Co. team after an eight-year career teaching fifth grade in McLean, Virginia. When Rick isn’t working hard for his clients, he can be found engaging in a number of activities with his synagogue; in his aerial studio hanging from the ceiling on aerial silks or hand-standing on the ground; playing with his English Bulldog, Han Solo, and his cats, Apollo and Pauley; taking advantage of the many museums and theaters the city has to offer; traveling; or nurturing his extensive gardens and houseplant collection. Rick and his husband also share a love of Formula 1, and this has lead to some exciting world travel!
title: Realtor®

description: About David To David, success in real estate is all about providing excellent client service. Whether you are preparing your home for sale, or looking for a new home, David is always there to help clients safely and effectively navigate the process. Consistent with his dedication to client service, David enjoys a 100% satisfaction and approval rating former clients. In addition to his commitment to client service, David brings an extensive corporate background in sales, sales management, , operations, contract negotiations, training and customer service to his real estate career. This experience not only benefits his clients’ goals and objectives but has helped David become a top producing agent year after year. David is honored to have been selected as one of the first agents recruited to help Compass expand into the commonwealth of Virginia and establish an office in Clarendon. Proudly serving Northern Virginia and The District of Columbia.
title: Realtor

description: About Phoenix As a native Washingtonian, Phoenix Wright brings his clients an unrivaled knowledge of some of the most coveted neighborhoods in the area. As a former teacher and coach, Phoenix knows how to explain complex topics, a skill that he brings to his real estate practice. He is able to guide his clients through the intricacies of the real estate process while making the entire experience enjoyable. As a top agent at Compass Real Estate, Phoenix has assisted almost 150 clients in finding their place in the world and has accumulated over $100 million in career sales. Phoenix graduated from University of the District of Columbia with a concentration in English. After graduating, he spent nine months exploring South America which helped him improve on his communication skills, and increase his global awareness. Outside of real estate, Phoenix enjoys being active for and within his community; by donating 5% of all commissions to local charities in the DC area, specifically to Breadcoin. He also is an avid cyclist, having biked two 110-mile rides to raise funds for the Equal Justice Initiative and the Autism Awareness Foundation.
title: Senior Vice President

description: About James Realtor® and Team Lead James Wu has expertly guided his clients through the complicated business of buying, listing, selling and financing homes more than a decade. With a professional background both sales and real estate finance, James maintains a highly successful sales record on behalf of his many clients even through weak real estate markets. Fluent both in English and Chinese, James combines personal service with expertise in every area of the real estate market, including unique experience as a relocation expert, residential specialist, and listing expert. He is a member of the National Association of Realtors® and The Greater Capital Area Association of Realtors®.
title: Real Estate Advisor

description: About Hans Hans is one of the highest producing real estate agents in the United States and is considered one of the industry's thought leaders. A seasoned entrepreneur with a B.A. from Yale University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School, Hans brings a high level of financial rigor and business acumen to each transaction. Along with his brother and business partner, Steve, Hans has co-authored several articles on real estate for The Washington Post , as well as a book, Inside The Sell . Hans has trained and mentored scores of agents over the years, received dozens of awards including being recognized as the "Most Innovative Realtor in America" (Inman News), and built Wydler Brothers into a highly respected boutique brokerage firm which he and Steve sold to Compass in 2019. Simply put, Hans has one of the finest reputations in the business. He's a trusted resource and advocate for his clients & peers. If he's not your go-to residential real estate expert, he should be. #1 Large Team in Washington, D.C. Wall Street Journal | #RealTrendsVerified 2024 & 2025 wydlerbrothers.com . &amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;gt;

description: About Steve Steve Wydler, co-founder of Wydler Brothers of Compass alongside his brother Hans, is one of the highest-producing agents in the region. A reformed attorney, co-author of Inside the Sell: Top Agents Reveal Unspoken Secrets and Dangers of Buying and Selling Your Home, and regular contributor to The Washington Post. Steve brings a degree of legal experience, financial sophistication, and business acumen rarely seen in residential real estate. Wydler Brothers is consistently recognized as one of the nation’s leading teams and was ranked the #1 large team by volume in Washington, D.C. in Real Trends The Thousand in 2022. Steve is a zealous advocate for his clients’ interests and, with the help of his amazing team, consistently optimizes results for his clients. Steve is extremely well-networked and has a stellar reputation in the industry as both a colleague and a thought leader. Steve graduated cum laude from Dartmouth College and received a J.D. from Vanderbilt Law School where he was Associate Editor of the Vanderbilt Law Review . He has served on the NVAR Standard Forms Committee, is a founding member of the Dartmouth Big Green Agent Network and an active member of Washington Golf and Country Club. Last but not least, Steve is passionate about giving back and through various fund drives through the years, he and his team have raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for charities like A Wider Circle. A local area resident since 1995, Steve lives in McLean with his two daughters and rambunctious bernedoodle. When not working, Steve likely can be found embarrassing his teenage daughters or playing squash, tennis or golf. Client Testimonials ★★★★★ " My husband and I couldn't recommend Steve more highly. Steve assisted us 5 years ago with the purchase of a townhouse in Arlington. That experience was so positive that we stayed in touch over the years and when we were ready to move again, we knew without question that we wanted Steve to work with us on both the sale of our townhouse and the purchase of our new house. Steve and his team are truly fantastic -- very knowledgeable about the area and the market, responsive, and great about educating us, full of fantastic recommendations of vendors to use), and just really pleasant people to be around during what can be a stressful situation! Unbelievably, with Steve's marketing and good advice, our townhouse was under contract in one day and we never even had to have an open house. We ideally wanted to close on the sale of our townhouse as quickly as possible because we already had a date for the closing on the purchase of our new house. Everything went off without a hitch with both closings taking place on the same day, within 3 weeks of having a ratified contract. We would recommend Steve and his team to anyone. Great service; great people. " ★★★★★ " Steve Wydler and his team are simply the best at what they do. My husband and I have worked with them in buying and selling our home. During the home-buying process, Steve was patient, attentive to our requests, kind, and detailed in letting us know the positives and negatives in each home we considered. When we were ready to sell our home, he was meticulous and determined to get us the best deal in this economy. Thanks to Steve and his team’s hard work, efforts, and great advice, we got an offer on the house in less than one week. Bottom line: if you want to find your dream home, the person to contact is Steve Wydler; if you want to sell your home fast and for the best possible price, the person to contact is Steve Wydler. " ★★★★★ " We worked with Steve on the purchase of a new home in McLean, and the sale of our existing McLean house. Steve and his team did a terrific job of helping us get our existing home ready to sell, and it sold before the open house. He and his team helped us evaluate the homes on the market, handled all of the negotiations, and we ended up with the house we wanted. Steve did a great job explaining the process and leading us through the various steps. It ended up being much easier than expected. He has a great team of professionals, as well as extensive knowledge of local resources. Highly recommended! " ★★★★★ " It was a pleasure working with Steve. He staged our house well and was knowledgeable about the neighborhood and the people who would be interested in purchasing. He kept us apprised through the whole process. We highly recommend him. " ★★★★★ " Steve lead a team of professionals who work very hard, effective, and efficient in presenting the house on the market, keeping us informed coming and going, and taking care of all details of the transactions. We learned a lot from this experience and have a real appreciation of how complicated a house sale is - it's really the best leaving it to the best professional. We were glad Steve was our agent. We recommend you check Steve out when selling or buying a house. "

Since then, they have grown their business to consistently be one of the top teams both in the Washington DC region and the entire United States. Along the way, they’ve achieved numerous awards and recognitions, including being recognized as “The Most Innovative Real Estate Agent in America” (Inman, 2014), written several articles for The Washington Post, authored a book, “Inside the Sell”, co-founded a real estate tech company which sold to Move, Inc. in 2013, and built Wydler Brothers into a highly respected boutique brokerage with 70 agents and employees which they sold to Compass in 2019. About Pamela Pam Wye is a native Washingtonian with real estate running through her blood. The daughter of a general contractor, Pam returned to DC a decade ago, and jumped right into world of helping clients buy and sell homes. After eight years in the business, Pam has closed over 200 transactions, averaging $25 million in sales annually. Pam specializes in neighborhoods across the city, including Capitol Hill, where she was born and raised, Logan Circle and Dupont Circle, areas she called home for five years, and Chevy Chase DC where she is raising her family. Pam truly enjoys opportunities to work all over the city including Kalorama, LeDroit Park, Brightwood, the Palisades, and Trinidad or, frankly, wherever her clients' needs take her. Pam is a believer that a strong knowledge of multiple neighborhoods and clients of all price ranges makes a well rounded real estate agent. Pam has achieved a level of success in a short amount of time, and her clients say she packs a mean punch of expertise, market knowledge and exceptional service. She has incredible organizational skills and a fine tuned ability to help her clients understand a within the context of a particular neighborhood and the DC area market. In 2011, Pam was recognized Realtor Magazine as one of the “30 Agents Under 30” , chosen GCAAR’s executive committee to be the 2011 Rookie of the , voted one of Washington City Paper’s best real estate agents , and included in Washingtonian's "Top Real Estate Agents" feature for several years. Pam is a former Vice President at TTR Sotheby’s International Realty, one of the youngest in the to receive the title for her sales record, and now is Vice President at Compass. Pam consistently works with several of the city's leading , including Ditto Residential, CAS Riegler, Monarch Urban and Alchemist, to represent their multi-unit and single-family home developments on the market. When Pam is not working, she treasures quality time with her family, particularly her husband (also a DC native) and two young boys, Mason who is 3 years old and Wyatt who is less than a year old. A favorite activity is spending an early weekend morning making breakfast with her kids. Pam is licensed in DC, MD, and VA. If you’re considering purchasing, selling, or investing, please contact her . A few things about Pam: Grew up on Capitol Hill Currently resides in Chevy Chase DC Mother to two young and very active boys
title: Senior Vice President

description: About Jenny Jenny is a committed real estate agent, who helps her clients navigate through the complex decision-making process inherent in today’s real estate market. With over 15 years of experience in the real estate industry, she is recognized as an agent focused on accountability, reliability, timeliness, and honesty. Whether purchasing or selling your house, Jenny's priority is to provide the best customer service. Jenny grew up in Falls Church and has been living in the DC Metropolitan area for most of her life. Using her deep resources and marketing tools, Jenny is a powerhouse in the Northern Virginia and DC markets.
title: Mollaan Babbington Group | Realtor®

description: About Ellie Ellie was born and raised in the DC-metro area. She’s seen the highs and lows of the market and affirms that there’s no better place in which to live and invest. Through the years, Ellie’s fascination with real estate has taken her beyond just selling it: she’s become a landlord, a condominium board member, a real estate writer and author, and an outspoken promoter of homeownership. She left behind a legal career to make her own mark in the real estate industry. Her greatest goal is to help millennials dominate the DC-metro housing market, thereby strengthening the local and national economies. Ellie draws from her strong contract negotiation skills and industry know-how to help each individual client succeed in their real estate transaction. In addition to her linguistic skills in Spanish and French, Ellie also brings interior design and rental experience to the table. Whether you’re buying a studio or a mansion, to rent out or to live in, each deserves to be fabulous. Ellie lives in the Del Ray neighborhood of Alexandria with her husband and two boys, where she’s often seen running, caffeinating, and throwing sensational parties. In addition to her real estate ventures, Ellie is a board member of the Tennessee State Society, a volunteer at the Kennedy Center, and a proud local alumna of Vanderbilt University. She is licensed in Washington, DC, Virginia, and Maryland.
title: Mollaan Babbington Group | Realtor®

description: About Diane Diane is a trusted advisor known for making the buying and selling experience feel clear, calm, and genuinely supported. Whether helping first-time buyers, long-time homeowners, or clients navigating major life transitions, she brings a rare blend of market expertise, emotional intelligence, and strategic focus to every interaction. Clients consistently describe Diane as attentive, responsive, and deeply thoughtful—someone who listens closely, offers honest guidance, and makes them feel like they’re her top priority. With a background in both residential and commercial real estate, as well as professional coaching, she’s especially skilled at helping people clarify their goals and move forward with confidence. Having lived and worked on both coasts, Diane understands that real estate isn’t just about the property—it’s about timing, lifestyle, and the life you’re building. She approaches each transaction with care and clarity, always acting in her clients’ best interests. Beyond real estate, Diane serves on the board of the Spirit Club Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to inclusive fitness and wellness for people with disabilities. She finds joy in time with her family and her beloved dog, Charlie, and values community connections that bring people together and make a place feel like home.
title: Realtor®

description: About Anna-Louisa A native of the Washington DC Metropolitan area, Anna-Louisa began her career as a top-producing sales rep for one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world. With a father in construction and a mother in real estate investing, Anna-Louisa pursued her passion for real estate and entrepreneurship in 2015. For Anna-Louisa Yon, real estate is all about making the best connections for her clients. Whether she's matching clients with the right home and seller, or tapping into her vast community-driven network, Anna-Louisa knows how to connect the people around her with the resources to bring their real estate goals to life. As a lifelong resident of the DMV area, Anna-Louisa offers unrivaled insight into each of its vibrant neighborhoods—from the scenic pathways of Bethesda, to the bustling streets of Capitol Hill, where she calls home today. Thanks to her industry experience and local ties, she guides her clients with knowledge and compassion. Anna has consistently been recognized as a top agent within Compass as well as one of the top agents in the Washington DC area by the Washingtonian and other industry publications. When she is not working, Anna-Louisa enjoys traveling overseas to visit family with her husband and children.
title: VP and Managing Partner

description: About Gordon Meet Gordon, a unique professional who brings a culinary and hospitality flair to the world of real estate. With a degree in Culinary Arts Management from the prestigious Culinary Institute of America, Gordon's journey began in the hospitality industry, where he successfully managed several restaurants throughout the DMV area. Transitioning to real estate in 2009, Gordon discovered that the skills he honed as a restaurant manager seamlessly transferred to this new endeavor. His keen attention to detail, intuitive understanding of his clients' needs, and unwavering patience make him a standout in the real estate world. Recognizing the gravity of real estate transactions, Gordon acquired licenses in Maryland, D.C., and Virginia, proving himself a formidable force in various areas and towns across the region. His resourcefulness shines when it comes to surmounting obstacles and ensuring every transaction reaches the finish line. Whether it involves coordinating virtual tours for out-of-area clients, managing home inspection repairs, or facilitating moves and furniture pickups for donation to places like A Wider Circle or Habitat ReStore, Gordon handles it all with finesse. His expertise spans a diverse range of real estate transactions, from helping families navigate the complexities of closing an estate after the loss of a loved one to adeptly handling short sales and foreclosure transactions. He also has experience in working on title and title insurance issues and is familiar with the process of condominium conversions in Washington, D.C. In addition, Gordon manages a portfolio of properties for many long-term clients, underscoring his commitment to delivering comprehensive real estate solutions. Gordon prides himself in being relatable with all kinds of buyers and sellers with no transaction being too big or too small. He is constantly keeping himself abreast of the changes that are happening within the real estate industry. He is licensed as an Associate Broker in Maryland and holds the GRI designation (Graduate, REALTOR Institute) Born and raised in Laurel, MD, where his parents still reside, Gordon is a native of Howard County. His commitment to his local community is mirrored in his current residence in Kensington, where he lives with his wife and their three young and energetic boys. Beyond his career, Gordon's most cherished moments often revolve around his family. You'll frequently find him immersed in playdates, attending birthday parties, or enjoying quality time with his sons. One of Gordon's true passions outside of work is his love for food and beverage. His backyard is one of the places where he gets to showcase his culinary expertise, adorned with an array of kitchen toys (grills, smokers, pizza ovens) that he masterfully employs for barbecues and creating delectable pizzas. Cooking is not just a hobby for him; it's a way to share memorable moments and delicious meals with his friends and family. In Gordon, you'll find not only a dedicated real estate professional but also a warm-hearted individual who values relationships, community, and the joy of life's simple pleasures.
title: Associate Broker

description: About Kimberly Kimberly grew up on Maryland’s Eastern Shore and has lived in the DC Metropolitan area for 25 years, giving her a deeply rooted connection to the region and the community. She is drawn to the area's dynamic energy and channels her own passion and enthusiasm into helping her clients find their own place within the community she loves. With a background in urban and suburban studies from George Mason University and prior experience at FEMA's National Flood Insurance Program, Kimberly offers unique insights into flood risks, property valuations, neighborhood selection, and investment property ROI. Backed by Compass's extensive resources, and licensed in VA, DC and MD, Kimberly navigates both buyers and sellers through an effortless and successful real estate experience. Outside of her professional pursuits, Kimberly is a certified yoga instructor, and is deeply involved in her community, organizing events for her neighborhood, and actively supporting small businesses and young entrepreneurs. You can often find her cheering on her son during one of his many sporting events, showcasing her dedication not just to her family, but to the vibrant fabric of the community she calls home. With Kimberly, you not only gain a knowledgeable realtor but also a passionate advocate for the DMV and its residents.
title: Realtor®

description: About Your P&rtners Buying or selling a home can be an exhilarating experience filled with excitement and hope. But it can also cause a fair amount of uncertainty and anxiety. We get it. That’s why we named ourselves Your P&rtners. We are a seven-person team of experienced realtors dedicated to walk alongside you and guide you through your home sale or purchase. The “&” in our name represents that alliance and our commitment to be your strongest ally and biggest advocate during one of the most important milestones and biggest financial decisions in your life. Whether you are a young couple moving from an Adams Morgan walk-up to a Bethesda colonial, empty nesters from Tysons Corner downsizing to a Capitol Hill condo, budget conscious or luxury focused, we have you covered. With four generations represented on our team, and more than 46-years combined industry experience, our expertise encompasses the entire DC Metro area, and we lead the charge with Compass’s data-driven platforms and innovative technology. We know the area’s best offerings, resources and vendors and have insight into every local market, neighborhood, school district and tax code. Our approach to home buying and selling is to be helpful, hands-on and to have fun. And our promise to you is to find the best homes and negotiate the best prices…again & again & again.

About Shaye LICENSED IN DC Maryland Virginia Florida PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE Repeatedly recognized among Washingtonian Magazine's "Best of" real estate agents, Shaye Zakotnik is celebrated for her ability to deliver a bespoke real estate experience that not only exceeds client expectations but also enriches their lives in meaningful ways. Since 2011, Shaye has built an impressive track record with over $160 million in career sales, seamlessly blending deep market expertise with an unwavering commitment to her clients. With experience spanning the DC, Maryland, and Virginia markets as well as the exclusive Florida Keys, she brings a rare depth of knowledge and versatility to every transaction. Her portfolio includes a diverse clientele—ranging from seasoned investors and developers to first-time buyers and high-net-worth individuals—each receiving a refined, tailored approach that reflects the distinct needs of their journey. Shaye’s process is defined by integrity, expertise, and empowerment. With a consultative mindset, she artfully combines analytical precision, skilled negotiation, and a discerning eye for design to guide her clients to extraordinary outcomes. Whether curating a seamless luxury experience or introducing first-time buyers to their dream home, she fosters a relationship-driven approach that aligns with her clients’ goals and lifestyles. Known for her ability to navigate complex markets with poise and precision, Shaye Zakotnik is not just a trusted advisor—she is a partner in helping her clients build legacies through real estate. title: Real Estate Agent

description: About Brooke Brooke is a licensed real estate agent serving the Northern Virginia and Washington, D.C. areas. A native of Northern Virginia and the daughter of an entrepreneur, Brooke brings local expertise and professional insight to her clients. She holds a degree in Business Administration with a concentration in marketing from George Mason University, which equips her with the skills to effectively serve diverse individuals. Brooke has a proven track record of helping buyers and sellers succeed, particularly in multiple-offer situations, by leveraging her thorough understanding of contracts, market trends, and data driven decision making, while always keeping her clients’ goals at the forefront. Highly involved in the real estate community, Brooke has served with the Northern Virginia Association of Realtors® on the Young Professionals Network, CARES Committee, Northern Virginia Realtors® Political Action Committee (NVRPAC), and is a graduate of The Leadership Institute. At the state level, she contributes her time and expertise as a member of the Virginia Realtors® Professional Development Committee. These roles reflect her commitment to ongoing education, ethical leadership, and advocating for both her clients and the industry as a whole. Known for her responsiveness, attention to detail, and hands on approach, Brooke prides herself on building lasting relationships and being a trusted resource before, during, and long after the transaction. Outside of real estate, she enjoys spending time with family and friends, playing with her dog Sweet Pea, attending pilates and spin classes, and discovering new local restaurants, staying connected to the community she loves to call home.
title: Realtor® | Licensed in VA & DC

description: About Matthew Licensed in DC, Maryland and Virginia, Matt Zanolli has conducted nearly $350 million in successful real estate transactions throughout his career, which is largely based on word-of-mouth referrals and repeat clients. Nationally ranked in the top 1.5% of agents by The Wall Street Journal’s Real Trends, Matt understands the importance of authenticity and trust in our fast-paced and competitive market. Matt believes in educating his buyers and sellers to ensure they reach their goals. K nown for his focused and friendly approach, Matt has extensive expertise with historic homes and luxury condominiums and cooperatives. He brings an in-depth understanding of the local real estate market, negotiates fiercely on behalf of his clients and conducts his business with unwavering integrity. A Washingtonian since 1997 and a historic homeowner since 1999, Matt knows the city inside and out. As a real estate professional, he loves working across the area and keeps his finger on the pulse of the city’s happenings. Raised in Massachusetts, Matt fell in love with DC when he served as congressional intern while an undergrad at Stonehill College before settling here permanently. He also studied as an Erasmus scholar at the University of Grenoble in France. Drawn to the entrepreneurial nature of real estate, Matt enjoys the intricacies of running his own business and is continually grateful that his career allows a unique lens to experience our beautiful city and interact with its residents. He began his real estate career with Long & Foster, became a partner and founding member of Keller Williams Bethesda office, and then was recruited by Compass in 2016 to serve as senior vice president. Matt began his professional journey with Ruesch International as a corporate foreign currency trader and later as the company’s youngest country director in Zurich, Switzerland. Returning to the U.S., he transitioned to consulting and project management with KPMG and Freddie Mac, while earning a master’s degree from Johns Hopkins Carey School of Business. The finance, project management and interpersonal skills he honed during this time were a natural fit for his growing real estate practice. Matt has been active with local civic associations, served as a board member and volunteer for several nonprofits, and is a certified diver in SCUBA. He enjoys Mah Jongg, reading, architecture and traveling internationally (at last count he’s visited 40 countries).
title: Senior Vice President

description: About Shiva Choosing a place to live is not a decision Shiva takes lightly. Having lived and traveled around the globe, she understands the importance of finding just the right place to call home. Her background and life experience make her committed to helping her clients find the place that suits them best. As a former CPA and tax accountant, who opened and operated a successful business, Shiva has spent her entire career acquiring the skills that make her a successful, sought-after agent. Her extensive background in finance makes her a qualified negotiator, who tirelessly advocates for her clients. Her marketing expertise enables her to highlight the best features of her clients’ homes to achieve maximal market exposure. Shiva recognizes the complexity of real estate transactions; to combat this she builds relationships, utilizes her problem-solving skills, and follows a self-created systematic process to ensure the smoothest journey possible for her clients. Communication is the foundation of Shiva’s business. She prides herself on being responsive by providing personal undivided attention from start to finish. Real estate is often time sensitive, so she aims to provide her clients with the most up-to-date information at all times. A Bethesda resident for nearly 30 years, Shiva raised a child and recently built her own home in the area, making her well-versed in the process. As well as the metro area’s best offerings, resources and vendors. She values honesty and integrity and prides herself on being a good listener and an authentic and transparent, full-service advisor. Whether her clients are buying, selling (or both), she not only guides them through the process, she looks out for their best interests every step along the way. Shiva’s mission is to maximize profit and satisfaction for her clients. Learn more about Shiva here !
title: Realtor® licensed in DC, MD & VA

description: About Amy Consistently ranked one of the top producing agents in the Washington DC Metropolitan area, Amy's extensive market knowledge, dynamic negotiating skills, and unparalleled service make her an invaluable assets to her clients. Licensed and knowledgeable in VA, DC, and MD, Amy has been featured on HGTV's “House Hunters,” and cited in The Washington Post, as well as earned titles such as REAL Trends’ “America’s Best;” Top Team by Volume, Northern Virginia, and Top Real Estate Producer by Arlington Magazine. Amy has successfully negotiated over $300 million in sales volume, helping hundreds of families accomplish their real estate goals. Whether looking to buy, sell, build, or invest, Amy understands what it takes to achieve winning results for her clients. She prides herself on being proactive, aggressive, and solution- oriented, while creating lasting relationships with her clients. Amy believes the real estate process can, and should be, an enjoyable one! Through her dedication and expertise, she strives to give that experience to every one of her clients.
title: Executive Vice President, Compass | Licensed in DC, MD & VA

description: About Gregg With over 40 years in the D.C. area, Gregg Zeiler knows the DMV like few others. From quiet suburban streets to vibrant urban neighborhoods, Gregg brings unmatched insight into the communities that make this region such a great place to live. His local knowledge gives buyers and sellers the confidence they need to make smart, informed decisions. A proud graduate of the University of Maryland with a degree in Finance, Gregg’s career spans more than three decades across industries including IT, construction, financial planning, property management, and real estate relocation. That wide-ranging experience gives him a unique edge — he sees every deal from multiple angles and guides his clients through each step with strategy and care. Gregg is known for his steady, patient approach and his ability to really listen — qualities that make him a skilled negotiator and trusted advisor. He’s committed to advocating for his clients’ best interests, whether they’re buying their first home, upgrading, or making an investment. His dedication to excellence and leadership across industries earned him a place in the prestigious Marquis Who’s Who , a recognition reserved for professionals who have demonstrated noteworthy achievement in their fields. Originally from Colorado, Gregg has a lifelong love of the outdoors — skiing, golfing, and chasing new adventures. His passion for modern architecture and thoughtful design is what first drew him to real estate, and today, he combines that eye for style with a talent for helping people find the one . When he’s not working, you’ll find Gregg relaxing with a good crime novel, a glass of wine (or a Zeilered martini), and a fine cigar — or entertaining close friends and family, just the way he likes it. Client Testimonials Scroll down for more ★★★★★ " It is impossible to overstate how good Greg and Janet are at their profession. They are consummate professionals that know the market. They sold our home before it even went to market and for well over our asking price. In addition to their real estate prowess, they are amazing human beings. They are thoughtful, caring, and empathetic. No question is too small or too big. I highly recommend them without hesitation. " - Angelo Terrana ★★★★★ " Gregg was recommended to us when we decided to "downsize" after over 20 years in our house. This was not an easy process for us coupled with the nature of our purchase in that we needed to "move out" on the sales process at an undetermined point.Gregg exhibited an exemplary level of patience with us and was supportive to us throughout the process, never applying pressure but always providing encouragement and recommendations (and pastries). When the time for us to "move out" on the sales process Gregg guided us through each step and the results far exceeded our expectations. I would recommend Gregg to anyone. " - Mark Burroughs ★★★★★ " Working with Gregg is truly a dream! He has impeccable style, an eye for detail and a can-do attitude that makes every transaction seamless. He's incredibly professional, always on top of things and consistently finds the best deals for his clients. His mix of expertise, efficiency, and genuine care make him such a pleasure to work with. Highly recommend him to anyone looking to buy or sell! " - Simmons Team ★★★★★ " As a fellow Realtor, I've had the privilege of working with many Agents both locally and nationally (through referrals both to and from other Agents), but few demonstrate the level of professionalism, skill, integrity, communication skills and client dedication that Gregg Zeiler does. His commitment to excellence and to serving his clients goes far beyond the transaction - he genuinely cares about their goals, concerns and overall experience. It's rare to find someone who balances strong market knowledge with such a warm and service driven approach and who can get the job done. Gregg is a true asset to the industry, the community and his clients. Whether you are buying or selling a home, if you are looking for a Realtor in the MD/VA/DC area that will go above and beyond with professionalism and heart, Gregg is the only one to call! " - Karen Harned ★★★★★ " My husband and I recently had the pleasure of working with Gregg & Janet to find my dream first home, and I couldn't be happier with the experience. From the very beginning, they made everything so smooth, efficient, and just plain enjoyable. Their dedication and talent truly shine through! One thing I really appreciate about Gregg and Janet is how well they listen. They make you feel like your needs and wants are their top priority, and they take the time to really understand what you're looking for. Their warm and friendly personalities make the whole journey feel comfortable and supportive. By the time it's all done, you won't just have a fantastic new home—you'll also have some wonderful new friends!I can't recommend Gregg and Janet enough to anyone thinking about buying or selling a home. Their expertise, kindness, and genuine care for their clients really make them stand out. Thank you, Gregg and Janet, for making our home-buying adventure such a memorable one! " - Gabriel Plazola ★★★★★ " Our experience with Compass was a total journey. Gregg Zeiler and Janet Million were our experienced guides. Why a total journey, because it was not just one of selling our home, but several factors that could have made the sale difficult. We moved out of state and the house needed to be renovated. We hired a contractor who knew our vision, but Gregg and Janet worked collaboratively with him to plan and execute a design that would increase the value and sales appeal of the home. They encouraged a reasonable timeline completion for a seamless and beautiful transition into a finished product that had market appeal and solid sales value. They kept in communication with us, and we could trust that based on their knowledge of real estate and buyer demand, their decisions were tasteful, reasonable and well executed. We were not disappointed! When completed, the home had multiple viewers and was sold within three days! Should we mention that the sale price was at significant increase in value above other homes previously sold in the area. Our journey could not be completed without our also having to solve the problem of selecting a reliable company to help us with our “cross country” move. We were aware of many “horror” stories of loss and damage by movers. We did research, but were still unsure. Gregg and Janet came to our rescue by giving us an excellent recommendation for a moving company. Again, they were right on target! Everything arrived safely to our new home. The sale of a home can be an emotional and challenging experience, but if you have to make this journey, we could recommend no better guides than Gregg Zeiler and Janet Million at Compass Real Estate. Your successful destination arrival is guaranteed! " - Barbara and Regina Oglesby ★★★★★ " I had the pleasure of working with Gregg to purchase my first home, and I can't express how grateful I am for the incredible support and service he provided to me throughout the entire process. From start to finish, he went above and beyond to make my first home purchase as smooth as possible. Gregg patiently answered all of my questions and explained the complexities of the real estate market in a way that was easy for a first-time buyer like me to understand. His level of knowledge, responsiveness and transparency instantly put me at ease and gave me confidence in the decisions I was making. I highly recommend Gregg to anyone in need of a real estate agent who is not only very experienced, but also genuinely cares about his clients' well-being. If you're a first-time homebuyer like me or an experienced buyer, Gregg is the agent you want by your side! " - Ruben B. ★★★★★ " We initially worked with Gregg purchasing our home and when it was time to sell he was our first and only call. Gregg is from the area and knew the pluses and minuses of every neighborhood. Much more than his knowledge was his compassion in finding us the best house and then the best deal. We have moved many times in the past 10 years. Gregg is the gold standard. " - Dennis C. ★★★★★ " We were lucky enough to stumble upon Gregg through a reference from one of his co-workers. I honestly could not recommend anyone more. At the time, I was in my third trimester with our first child, and my husband and I had about 3 months to find and buy our first home before our apartment lease was up. We had been casually searching on our own for over 6 months with no luck. To say we were in over our heads is an understatement, especially in the DC metro market. From the moment we met Gregg, though, we knew we were in good hands. His experience, availability, desire to help, and generosity made all the difference. In the end, we were able to close about a month before our lease was up, giving us plenty of time to move (especially considering we’ve now got a newborn to handle in the midst of it all). Gregg was vital to making sure the process went smoothly and, without his expertise, there’s no way we could have made this happen. He took what was an incredibly stressful situation and made us feel at ease. Especially as first time buyers, his patience and ability to explain the process made us feel so much more confident in our decisions. If you need a realtor, choose Gregg. I promise you won’t be disappointed. " -Kristin H. ​​
title: Realtor ® | Vice President | Licensed in DC, MD & VA

description: About Kristie Kristie was born Pittsburgh PA and is a graduate of the Indiana University of PA. She has dedicated her career to a business-savvy buying, selling or investment experience. In up, down or stable markets she thrives on the hustle and connecting resources with her encouraging personality and staying power. Her clients return time and time again for market acumen, attention to detail and honest advice. She matches clients’ lifestyles with community and location, allowing them to live a joyful home life. Whether you’re a first-time buyer, move-up buyer/seller or selling your home to downsize or relocate, Kristie is passionate about helping you make your move. Kristie’s sister has served our nation in the US Army and her father is a Vietnam Veteran so one of the missions close to her heart is helping military families. She has a special understanding of the relocation process and service that military members need during the transition. She supports Veterans organizations locally as well as across the United States. Real estate aside, Kristie enjoys the DC Metro culture exploring restaurants, artistic performances, and local spa getaways. She is ‘mom’ to two toy Yorkies and supports the Animal Welfare League of Alexandria.
title: Realtor®

description: About MaryAshley MaryAshley Zimmermann is a real estate industry veteran based in Alexandria, Virginia, with more than eighteen years of experience guiding and advising her clients in their real estate transactions. Whether buying or selling, MaryAshley’s expertise and systematic approach ensures efficient and savvy negotiations, but it is her integrity and friendly manner that have secured a loyal following of existing clients, and an impressive, growing list of client referrals. Testimonials from her clients praise MaryAshley’s proactive approach, the way she anticipates and exceeds expectations, and handles transactions with the care and understanding of someone who knows firsthand the stress of buying or selling a home. MaryAshley removes that stress with her confidence professionalism, makes the entire process—from your first meeting your closing— only successful but enjoyable too. A native of Connecticut, MaryAshley began her career as a realtor Boston after graduating with a degree in Political Science Philosophy from Trinity College in Hartford. Her passion for sales ignited at a young age; as a former Equine Professional, MaryAshley brokered the sales and of show horses across England. Negotiating sales and providing exceptional customer service are the driving forces behind MaryAshley’s outstanding work ethic. Since moving to Alexandria in 2010, MaryAshley has become a respected name in the industry, and a trusted leader in the markets she specializes in—Washington, D.C., and Northern Virginia. As a resident of the metro DC area herself, she only loves where she lives but is privy to the best places to live, dine, exercise, shop. MaryAshley is a longtime vegan, animal lover, supporter of Rancho Relaxo, King Street Cats, and Our Companions Animal Sanctuary. She resides in Alexandria with her two children and a rescued cat and dog siblings.
title: Realtor®

description: About Mary Originally from Ohio, Mary has called DC her home for the last 40 years and has witnessed the city evolve to become the vibrant, dynamic place it is today. Named Rookie of the Year in 2001, Mary is passionate about empowering her clients to achieve their real estate goals. She enjoys working with clients at all stages of life, whether it be first time home buyers, those looking to downsize, or investors. Mary loves partnering with buyers to bring their distinct vision to life, always ensuring that she goes the extra mile strongly advocating for their interests at every step of the way. Determined to secure the best possible offer for sellers, Mary conducts thorough assessments and works closely with her clients offering useful tips and advice on everything from paint color, to staging and . As a former editor, Mary is inherently detail-oriented, which serves her well as she handles contracts and helps her clients to navigate the nuances of the real estate process with ease. With strong negotiation skills and unparalleled local insight, Mary combines expertise with fun to create personalized experiences for each client she works with. Mary lives with her husband in Washington, DC, and their three grown children all live nearby. She enjoys the theatre, sports, and exploring all that the city has to offer. Whenever possible, they escape to their lake house in Virginia.
title: Realtor®

description: About Marcela "From the moment we met to the day we received the keys to our new home and beyond, Marcela was helpful, understanding and just plain outstanding, " these are the words of commendation from one of Marcela's clients. Marcela works diligently to help her clients achieve their real estate goals, based on her experience, market knowledge, and a full-time commitment. Fully bilingual in Spanish and English, she has helped her clients understand the buying and selling process, facilitating the communication with lenders, and other parties involved in real estate transactions. Marcela keeps updated on new laws and regulations that affect the real estate market, taxes, and forms. Being a former teacher herself, she makes continuous education one of her top priorities as a real estate professional. Marcela has also graduated from the Brian Buffini Lead Generation Program, and the Floyd Wickman International Academy, one of the most rigorous programs in the country. Marcela is also a certified SMARTMOVE agent and a rental specialist and has helped families relocate in and out of the Washington area. Marcela earned the 2023 COMPASS TOP AGENT award, and was a finalist in the 2023 Bethesda Magazine Reader's Poll in the real estate category. She has recently earned the 2025 GCAAR Recognition Award in the Gold category.
title: Realtor®
